speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: SCENE V. Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA, CHARMIAN, IRAS, and MARDIAN

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Charmian!

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Madam?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ha, ha!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Give me to drink mandragora.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Why, madam?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That I might sleep out this great gap of time

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: My Antony is away.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: You think of him too much.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O, 'tis treason!

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: Madam, I trust, not so.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Thou, eunuch Mardian!

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: What's your highness' pleasure?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Not now to hear thee sing; I take no pleasure

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In aught an eunuch has: 'tis well for thee,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That, being unseminar'd, thy freer thoughts

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: May not fly forth of Egypt. Hast thou affections?

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: Yes, gracious madam.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Indeed!

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: Not in deed, madam; for I can do nothing

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: But what indeed is honest to be done:

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: Yet have I fierce affections, and think

speaker: MARDIAN
text_entry: What Venus did with Mars.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Where think'st thou he is now? Stands he, or sits he?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or does he walk? or is he on his horse?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O happy horse, to bear the weight of Antony!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Do bravely, horse! for wot'st thou whom thou movest?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The demi-Atlas of this earth, the arm

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And burgonet of men. He's speaking now,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or murmuring 'Where's my serpent of old Nile?'

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: For so he calls me: now I feed myself

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: With most delicious poison. Think on me,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That am with Phoebus' amorous pinches black,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: And wrinkled deep in time? Broad-fronted Caesar,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: When thou wast here above the ground, I was

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: A morsel for a monarch: and great Pompey

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: There would he anchor his aspect and die

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: With looking on his life.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Enter ALEXAS, from OCTAVIUS CAESAR

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Sovereign of Egypt, hail!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: How much unlike art thou Mark Antony!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Yet, coming from him, that great medicine hath

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: With his tinct gilded thee.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: How goes it with my brave Mark Antony?

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Last thing he did, dear queen,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: He kiss'd,--the last of many doubled kisses,--

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: This orient pearl. His speech sticks in my heart.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Mine ear must pluck it thence.

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: 'Good friend,' quoth he,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: 'Say, the firm Roman to great Egypt sends

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: This treasure of an oyster; at whose foot,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: To mend the petty present, I will piece

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Her opulent throne with kingdoms; all the east,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Say thou, shall call her mistress.' So he nodded,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: And soberly did mount an arm-gaunt steed,

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Who neigh'd so high, that what I would have spoke

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Was beastly dumb'd by him.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: What, was he sad or merry?

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Like to the time o' the year between the extremes

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Of hot and cold, he was nor sad nor merry.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O well-divided disposition! Note him,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Note him good Charmian, 'tis the man; but note him:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: He was not sad, for he would shine on those

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: That make their looks by his; he was not merry,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Which seem'd to tell them his remembrance lay

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: In Egypt with his joy; but between both:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O heavenly mingle! Be'st thou sad or merry,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The violence of either thee becomes,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: So does it no man else. Met'st thou my posts?

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Ay, madam, twenty several messengers:

speaker: ALEXAS
text_entry: Why do you send so thick?

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Who's born that day

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: When I forget to send to Antony,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Shall die a beggar. Ink and paper, Charmian.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Welcome, my good Alexas. Did I, Charmian,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Ever love Caesar so?

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: O that brave Caesar!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Be choked with such another emphasis!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Say, the brave Antony.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: The valiant Caesar!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: By Isis, I will give thee bloody teeth,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: If thou with Caesar paragon again

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: My man of men.

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: By your most gracious pardon,

speaker: CHARMIAN
text_entry: I sing but after you.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: My salad days,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: When I was green in judgment: cold in blood,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: To say as I said then! But, come, away;

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Get me ink and paper:

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: He shall have every day a several greeting,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Or I'll unpeople Egypt.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Exeunt
